result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were canceled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*Probation can be transferred to Waukesha County if they agree to accept it.
*If successfully completes probation, Court would grant conditional discharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Connor M Murray

defendant.name: Murray, Connor M
defendant.address: W287 N3826 N Shore Drive, Pewaukee, WI 53072

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: letter from defendant requesting permission to leave country on a family vacation **cc:  ADA Cass Cousins and Atty David Gardner Casey

Defendant Connor M Murray in court with attorney David Gardner Casey. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM118, 16TR536 & 16TR537.

9:08 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
BY THE COURT - **Count 1 is amended to 961.41(3g)(b) 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM118:
Count 1 (amended) - Guilty 
Count 2 - DRI

16TR536:
Count 1 - Guilty 

16TR537:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 16CM118 and Count 1 of 16TR536; Count 2 of 16CM118 and Count 1 of 15TR537 is DRI.  Clerk directed to withhold entry of Judgment of Conviction this date.
**Conditional discharge pursuant to the statute.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Casey makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
16CM118:
**Count 1 (amended) -
Placed on probation for 12 months
Pay costs/surcharges which would include the DNA Surcharge
Perform 25 hours of community service
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in any treatment or counseling recommended by the agent.
Probation can be transferred to Waukesha County if they agree to accept it.
If successfully completes probation Court would grant conditional discharge.

**Count 2 - DRI

16TR536:
**Count 1 -
Pay forfeiture of $250 plus costs
6 month DL revocation
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
6 merit points


16TR537:
**Count 1 - DRI
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Connor M Murray
Current: W287 N3826 N Shore Drive, Pewaukee, WI 53072 United States  (Effective: 05-09-2016)
Prior: 615 Garfield Ave, Wausau, WI 54401
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances

Defendant Connor M Murray in court with attorney David Gardner Casey. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:29 p.m.  Court is in session.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered by Attorney. 
NG pleas accepted by the Court.

State recommends a $200.00 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
